title: DMs and starred channels missing from sidebar

notes.body:
Issue Summary:

On August 23, 2019 at 10:50 a.m. PDT, some customers reported seeing issues with their direct messages (DMs) not showing on the sidebar in their workspace.

Our team investigated and discovered that a recently deployed code change meant to prevent redundant loading of member data caused a regression. This resulted in Slack not fetching the necessary member data to show DMs in the sidebar.

Our team was then able to remedy the initial code change, resolving the issue for all customers on August 23, 2019 at 4:05 p.m. PDT.

We have identified the issue causing DMs be removed from the sidebar, and we have rolled out a fix. Clearing your cache and refreshing should solve this issue.

Stars missing from the sidebar has been identified as an iOS bug. Anyone who wrote in about this issue will be contacted when we've resolved the bug. 

Thanks for your patience!
We're afraid we have no updates for now, though our team is actively investigating this issue. We will post again once we have new news to share. Thank you for your patience!
Apologies for the continued sidebar issues. We are still diligently investigating.
We're still actively pursuing what might be causing this. Thanks again for sticking with us!
We're still digging into this issue, and will share updates as they become available. Thank you again for bearing with us in the meantime.
Still no news to share, but we're working hard to identify how to get this one fixed. We'll let you know once more details are available.
We still haven't gotten to the bottom of this issue, but are continuing to investigate. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused in the meantime.

We're still looking into why starred channels and DMs may not be appearing in the sidebar. For now, these conversations are still accessible via search and keyboard shortcuts. We'll continue to keep you posted as more news becomes available.

Some customers may be noticing that DMs and starred channels are not showing in their sidebars. We're currently investigating and will be back once we have more info. Thanks for your patience in the meantime.

title: Trouble with contact forms on our website

notes.body:
On August 22, 2019 at 10:09 a.m. PDT, we deployed a code change that resulted in all forms on our website being unusable for customers. This included the "Contact Us" form and the sign up form, among others.
Our team became aware of the issue and reverted the previous code change resolving the issue on August 23, 2019 at 12:47 PDT.

title: Trouble searching, mentioning, and messaging team members for some Grid customers

notes.body:
On August 16, 2019 at 5:25 a.m. PDT, we received a report that some Enterprise Grid users were unable to open a direct message, use the Quick Switcher or mention a team member in Slack. We identified that it was affecting a small number of customers who used the shared channels beta on their workspaces prior to migrating those workspaces to the same Enterprise Grid organization.

Due to a code change, we erroneously classified some users as being users from other external organizations. This is why those users could not be direct messaged or mentioned. We deployed a fix and by 12:17 p.m. PDT on August 21, 2019, the issue was fully resolved.
We now have the all-clear for this issue. We appreciate your patience while we confirmed these fixes, and apologize for any disruption to your day.

We have now pushed a fix for these issues Enterprise Grid members were experiencing though we will be monitoring things before we call an all-clear. Please let us know at feedback@slack.com if you continue to see issues with mentioning, searching, and messaging other members. 

For anyone experiencing these issues on a mobile device, please perform a cache clear to receive this fix: Settings > Advanced > Reset cache.

We're continuing to investigate users on Enterprise Grid who are unable to mention, search and direct messages some members. We appreciate your patience and we will provide an update once it is resolved.
Some people may be having trouble searching for teammates. We’re currently investigating and will let you know once we have more news to share. Thanks for your patience in the meantime.

title: Customers unable to access context menu on Admin page under certain resolutions.

notes.body:
Issue Summary:

On August 20, 2019, beginning at 5:22 p.m. PDT, some customers reported not being able to access the context menu on the Admin page. After some investigation, it was discovered that a change to the padding and layout of the Admin page meant some customers had trouble accessing the context menu on this page under certain resolutions.

By 10:35 p.m. PDT, the issue was resolved for all resolutions and customers were able to access the context menu again.

We’re happy to report that the issues with accessing the context menu on the Admin page have now been fixed. There are other elements on the same page that we are still working to align correctly. Please reach out to feedback@slack.com for more information on this effort. To those affected, we’re so sorry for the disruption to your day. Thanks for sticking with us on that.
We believe we've found the issue’s root cause and are working hard to get things back up and running. Thanks for bearing with us.
We're still trying to pin down the root cause of this context menu issue. We hope to bring some good news soon.
We have no new information to share just yet, but we're continuing our efforts. Thanks for your patience here.

Some people may be having issues with accessing the context menu on their Admin page under certain resolutions. We’re working on getting this sorted swiftly.

In the meantime, you should be able to work around this by adjusting the window size to smaller than 1473px by using the keyboard shortcut Cmd/Ctrl and "-" or larger than 1580px with the keyboard shortcut Cmd/Ctrl and "+".

title: Issues authenticating Google account with certain Slack apps

notes.body:
Issue Summary:

On July 16, 2019, at 1:56 p.m. PDT, we began a rollout of a new Google API Client. On July 17, we started receiving reports of various problems with Google Calendar and Google Drive integrations, including issues with authenticating and calendar events not displaying. Investigations began at 7:39 a.m., and we worked to identify and address each issue individually.

On July 19 at 12:00 p.m., the last fix was pushed out and we continued to monitor the situation. Some customers reported that they were still running into 500 errors in the Google Calendar app and we made a change to prevent this from happening.

Finally, we restored any calendar connections that had been lost. This was completed on July 26, at 4:11 p.m., and we declared the issue fully resolved.

We believe we have identified and fixed the issue affecting the Google integrations. If you're still not receiving notifications from "Google Calendar for Team Events" please try re-saving your integration configuration — which should get things running again. We're so sorry for all this hassle. Thank you for being so patient.

Some customers may still be having problems with the Google Drive and Google Calendar Slack apps. We had thought this was fixed but it looks like we spoke too soon. We'll update here as soon as it's fully patched. Again, we appreciate your patience.

Good news! We have pushed out a fix to resolve the Google authentication issue affecting the Google Drive and Google Calendar for Team Events apps. You may need to refresh for the changes to apply. Thanks for your patience!
We believe we mitigated most of the issues with Google authentication in Slack apps but we're not completely out of the woods. We're continuing work to restore full functionality.

title: Problems with the billing page and billing related emails from Slack

notes.body:
Issue Summary

From July 12, 2019 to July 15, 2019, we encountered issues with the systems used to to adjust credits on workspaces when membership or user activity changes.

We were able to restore the system on July 16, 2019, and backfilled data to adjust credits and provide refunds for teams overcharged. During this time, customers may have seen issues with missing or incorrect invoices, incorrect member changes in some emails, and incorrect information on their billing pages.

We've isolated the issue and have begun working to correct the member changes on the workspace billing page. We are taking steps to ensure that member changes are accurate moving forward, and that there are no more errors in the Admin weekly emails. We're sorry for any concern caused by this issue, and are working to make sure we can avoid this coming up again in the future. We'll report back with an Issue Summary shortly.
We’re still looking into the issues with the billing page and billing related emails, but we don’t have additional information to share just yet. We appreciate your patience.

Some workspaces may be seeing inaccurate counts of active and inactive members on their billing pages and in relevant emails. We've identified a possible fix to get things back in order, and we'll keep you posted once we have more news to share.

Some users may be noticing an incorrect user count on their workspace billing page, as well as errors in billing and admin related emails received from Slack. Thank you for bearing with us while we investigate further.

title: Degraded functionality with several features

notes.body:
Issue Summary:

On June 28, 2019 at 4:30 a.m. PDT some of our servers became unavailable, causing degraded performance in our job processing system. This resulted in delays or errors with features such notifications, unfurls, and message posting.

During this time, approximately 10-25% of jobs resulted in errors or failure. By 10:00 a.m. PDT, we fully restored message delivery and reduced the error rates to less than 5% as the team continued to work on a full recovery.

At 1:05 p.m. PDT, a separate issue increased server load and dropped a large number of user connections. Reconnection attempts further increased the server load, slowing down customer reconnection. Server capacity was freed up eventually, enabling all customers to reconnect by 1:36 p.m. PDT.

Full service restoration was completed by 7:20 p.m. PDT. During this period, customers faced delays or failure with a number of features including file uploads, notifications, search indexing, link unfurls, and reminders.

Now that service has been restored, the response team is continuing their investigation and working to calculate service interruption time as soon as possible. We’re also working on preventive measures to ensure that this doesn’t happen again in the future. If you’re still running into any issues, please reach out to us at feedback@slack.com.

A fix has been rolled out and all features should be working normally. We are immensely sorry for the disruption to your work day and are continuing the work to make sure this doesn't happen again. 

If you are still seeing any issues, please don't hesitate to drop us a line via our help page or feedback@slack.com — we're here to help.

We have no new information to share just yet, but we're continuing our efforts. We truly appreciate your patience.
Nothing new to share just yet, but we're working to get things back to normal as soon as possible. Again, we truly appreciate your patience.
We don't have any further updates right now, but thank you for your patience while we continue to investigate.
Users are experiencing troubles deleting and converting channels. Our team is getting to the bottom if it.

title: Recent messages not shown in search results

notes.body:
Issue Summary:

On March 17th at 6:29pm PDT, we received a report that the search feature was not returning the most recently posted messages. An internal investigation was launched.

We established that this was caused by a change made to the search infrastructure tooling at 5:00pm PDT. This resulted in search indexing failing to return messages posted after this change. Once this was identified, we were able to deploy a fix and resolve the issue at 8:37pm PDT on March 17th.

We’re investigating the root cause, as well as making plans to ensure this doesn’t happen in the future.
Recent messages should be appearing once again in your search results. Sorry for the hassle and thanks for sticking with us!
Recent messages may not be listed in search results at the moment. We are investigating, and we're very sorry for the disruption. Thank you for your patience.

title: Issues with starting and opening Direct Messages for some users

notes.body:
Issue Summary:

At 11:40 AM PDT on March 13, we made a code change that caused users to be unable to start a new DM from the “Direct Messages” menu on their channel sidebar. After identifying the issue, this change was rolled back for all users at 1:10 PM PDT and access to this menu was restored. Access to Direct Messages from the Quick Switcher and from usernames in the channel sidebar was unaffected during this period.
Full functionality for Direct Messages should be restored for all users! Please reload Slack for the fix to take effect.
We've received word that some users are experiencing reduced functionality with Direct Messages. We're investigating!

title: Team members appearing offline inaccurately

notes.body: Users should now appear online correctly for the rest of their team. We apologize for any confusion this may have caused! If you're still having troubles, please let us know at feedback@slack.com

Issue Summary:

On March 13th at 10:00am PT, some users were seeing the availability of their teammates incorrectly showing as “away”, even though they were online and actively using Slack. This issue affected some users located in various regions of APAC.

A recent deploy had introduced errors that were causing connection issues linked to user availability. Once this was identified, we rolled out a fix. After receiving confirmation from affected users, the issue was officially resolved as of 7:30am PT on March 15th.
While we're still working towards a complete resolution, team members will now appear online correctly for some customers. We appreciate you bearing with us.
Some team members may be appearing offline inaccurately. We’re currently investigating and will have more information shortly. Thank you for your patience.

title: Member list not displaying in newly created channels

notes.body:
Issue Summary: 

On March 12th around 5:30 PM PST, we became aware of an issue where users added to new channels were not able to view the list of members within that channel.

This was due to a caching bug discovered by our engineering team, who deployed a fix for this at 8:30 PM PST on March 13th. We've determined the root cause of this issue and made further changes to ensure this doesn't happen again. Please let us know if you require further assistance through feedback@slack.com.
Good news! Members are appearing again in newly created channels. We're sorry for any trouble this caused. Thanks for sticking with us.
We're continuing to investigate this issue. We'll report back as soon as this has been resolved! Thank you for your patience in the meantime.
We've seen reports that members are not displayed in the Channel Details sidebar in newly created channels. We’re looking into it as we speak. Thanks for your patience.

title: Org Dashboard is not loading for Grid customers

notes.body:
Issue Summary:

On March 12 at 9:48 AM PDT, we rolled out a change that caused the Org Dashboard to stop loading for Enterprise Grid customers. As a result, Org Admins and Owners were unable to make administrative changes. After investigating the problem, we reverted the change, which successfully returned functionality of this page at 11:44 AM PDT.
A fix has been deployed, however some customers may need to reload Slack by hitting SHIFT + CTRL(Win)/CMD(Mac) + R. Thank you for your patience.
We are happy to report Org Dashboards are back up and running! Apologies for the disruption to your day.
The Org Dashboard is not loading for some Grid customers. We are working hard to get it back up and running. Thank you for your patience!
Some people may be having an issue with Slack. We’re currently investigating and will have more information shortly. Thank you for your patience.

title: Issues with File Uploads for some workspaces

notes.body:
Issue Summary:

On March 6th at 8:30 AM PST and again at 10:40 AM PST, we removed two feature flags that caused file uploads to fail for some customers. Upon investigation, we identified the problematic flags and began reverting this change. All file upload functionality was restored by 12:33 PM PST.
File uploads should be working properly once again for all workspaces! Let us know at feedback@slack.com if any issues persist after a reload.
We're still working to fix file uploads, but some users are reporting success with uploads after refreshing Slack. Thank you for your patience in the meantime!
We're investigating issues with file uploads for some workspaces. We apologize for the inconvenience in the meantime.

title: Domain-based workspace signup is failing for all customers

notes.body:
Issue Summary: 

On March 5th at 2:28 PM PT we removed a feature flag aimed at improving the signup experience. Unfortunately, this introduced a bug in our signup flow which caused domain-based signup to fail for all users. At 2:51 PM PT, we began receiving customer reports of this issue. By 6:02 PM PT, we had identified the bug and reverted the change, which restored full functionality to domain-based signup mode.
We've been given the all-clear. Domain-based signup should be working for everyone once more. We really appreciate you sticking with us through that. Apologies for all that hassle.
Things are looking positive though we're still working to get to the bottom of this trouble with domain signup. Thanks again for your patience through this.
We’re still working on getting to the bottom of this. In the meantime, you should be able to join a workspace or invite people to a workspace by using a direct invite.
We're investigating why domain-based signups are not working correctly. Apologies for this disruption to your day.

title: Trouble with sending messages

notes.body:
Issue Summary: 

On February 19th at 3:00PM PT, we deployed a change to one of our core systems. At 3:03PM PT we received internal warnings that this change had caused elevated error rates in message sending and began investigating. By 4:39PM PT we had resolved the issue and all messages were sending as expected.

The team have been monitoring things and have given us the all-clear. If you are still experiencing issues with message delivery please let us know at feedback@slack.com. So sorry for all this hassle.
We're investigating why some people are having issues sending messages. Apologies for this disruption.
